mobs.long_desc: A sinister-looking forester advances upon you.
mobs.desc: He is tall and very burly, with well-developed muscles. His hazel eyes blaze with intensity, and one cheek twitches with some odd tic.

mobs.keywords: gaunt starved bunny rabbit gaunt-bunny thin
mobs.long_desc: A bone thin rabbit tries to duck away beneath the undergrowth.
mobs.desc: This small rabbit looks like it's been starved nearly to death, with its ribs clearly visible and its ragged fur. Despite its poor condition, the creation moves quickly, looking around with fear-wide eyes.

mobs.long_desc: A dark bird flies overhead.
mobs.desc: This hawklike bird is much darker than most examples of his breed, and much larger, as well.  His powerfully hooked beak is stained dark at the very tip.

mobs.long_desc: A buck with a bloodstained muzzle and rack hunts for prey.
mobs.desc: This buck is quite a specimen: A tall, muscular creature in his full maturity, with a rack of quality, multipronged antlers. But clear evidence of blood on his muzzle and on his antlers point to a difference from most deer.

mobs.long_desc: A man wanders the forest, checking plants and trees.
mobs.desc: This older fellow's grizzled form seems made for the black, threatening Twisted Forest.  He wears very old clothing that you suspect he bought in the nearby town to the northwest years ago and never replaced.  His concern for the local flora and fauna appears touching, but he spares most people not a second glance.

mobs.long_desc: A park ranger wanders the forest on his rounds.
mobs.desc: Once he might have been a champion of the lords of the village nearby, but now he is an evil shadow of his former self.  He's frothing mildly at the mouth, which, coupled with his obscene growls and snarls, makes him seem rather unapproachable.  His once-lordly attire was ruined what seems to be years ago.

mobs.keywords: darkseed mage black dark seed evil
mobs.long_desc: A mage dressed all in black gives you the evil eye.
mobs.desc: Perhaps this mage is one of the people responsible for the evils of the Twisted Forest! He's certainly cruel-looking enough, with his perpetual sneer, his harsh, slitted eyes, and his aura of malevolence. His black clothes swirl around him as he gestures at you.

mobs.long_desc: An evil-looking black deer sharpens its canines on a tree.
mobs.desc: What kind of deer could this be? It only marginally resembles the gentle, liquid-eyed beasts you know and adore having for dinner. Its coat is black and quite filthy with mud and some kind of slime, and its eyes seem brittle and cruel. Its teeth are sharp, its muzzle covered in what appears for all the world like dried blood.

mobs.long_desc: An evil-looking bird with greasy feathers stares at you balefully.
mobs.desc: This vulture is a very large bird, with a wingspan of easily the entire length of a man's body. The bird seems like a sorry specimen of its species, however; its feathers are dull and greasy, and its beak is even chipped in places. The hunting has not gone well for this avian.

mobs.keywords: pixie dark-pixie dark indigo-light indigo light
mobs.long_desc: A glowing indigo light seems to swoop at you!
mobs.desc: The ball of light seems to explode into a small humanoid shape, right before your eyes! The dark light surrounding it remains, though. What remains with it is what appears to be a child of about ten human years, which glittering black eyes and red fangs. It grins maliciously at you, and you realize that this 'child' must be considerably older than ten.

mobs.long_desc: A strange vagabond child marches past you vacantly.
mobs.desc: This little child, with his mop of curly blond hair, seems strangely out of place.  He doesn't seem to have any parents anywhere in evidence, though it is his clothing that clearly marks him as a vagabond child.  The rags hang on his tiny little frame.  The boy doesn't notice this, however; his vacant eyes seem to be concentrating on some kind of mission.

mobs.long_desc: A raccoon is foaming at the mouth!
mobs.desc: This brown and black striped raccoon, with its little black 'mask' and little handlike paws, isn't much larger than a dog, but its dark eyes are wide and foam flecks its mouth like soapsuds. It shifts back and forth continually, its balance clearly disturbed.

mobs.long_desc: An eagle with a molting problem looks very annoyed.
mobs.desc: This large eagle has bright golden eyes and dark gold plumage, most of which is falling out as it moults. Little pinfeathers stick to the edge of the bird's massive, hooked beak. It looks around quickly from time to time.

mobs.long_desc: An owl swoops by on nearly silent wings.
mobs.desc: This large bird is a fairly typical example of its species, with huge round golden eyes and brown plumage, except for the white feathers on its chest and stomach.  Its wings are very nearly silent, and the creature itself doesn't make any other noises like cheeps or songs.

mobs.long_desc: A badger roots its way around the undergrowth.
mobs.desc: This large animal, nearly the size of a dog, has short, bristly dark brown hair all over, a rodentlike snout, small ears, and short stubbly whiskers.  White stripes radiate out from its eyes to the back of its head.  It has very sharp teeth, which it doesn't hesitate to bare frequently.  Its short little legs convey it at an almost leisurely pace.

mobs.long_desc: A ruffled quail with dirty feathers screeches at you!
mobs.desc: This small bird looks strangely confident.  It stares straight ahead, with its wings hanging down, and its feathers all chaotic and twisty.  Its little black beak is shiny with a viscious liquid.

mobs.long_desc: A bloody-eyed tree rat squeaks angrily at you!
mobs.desc: The angry, staring eyes of this small rodent are worse than bloodshot -- they are simply full of blood!  Whether due to injury or disease it is unclear, but one thing is for certain, this small creature does have a case of bloodlust! Its mangy fur is dirty and torn, and one of its long, chisel-like incisors is broken.  This is one tough customer.

mobs.long_desc: A huge sow sleeps peacefully in the corner.
mobs.desc: Though she is peaceful in repose, one wouldn't want to be around when this massive pig is aroused!  She must weigh as much as a well-fed ogre.  Scars and burns cover her body and snout, where oddly enough, a pair of short tusks poke out.  Her tiny eyes are offset by a big set of floppy ears and legendary sense of smell.

mobs.long_desc: A thin, tall figure wearing robes and a hood stands here peacefully.
mobs.desc: The long gray robes and hood do much to obscure the true nature of this being, but with closer examination, it is revealed to be a man of some years.  His white beard and blue eyes lie in shadow, and his intentions remain masked. However, his attentiveness reveals a deep concern for the forest and its denizens.  The sorrow of this place is at least partly his.

mobs.long_desc: A haggard-looking brownie stands here with a dejected look.
mobs.desc: This small, brownish, elf-like creature bears the marks of abuse.  His ears are red and puffy, his nose sits askew, and red welts rise on nearly every bit of exposed skin.  Still, there is some stubbornness in him.  On the whole, he seems very unhappy.

mobs.long_desc: A small shadowlike being crouches in the darkness.
mobs.desc: The outline of this pixie is difficult to make out.  He is dark in color, and resembles a shadow, though he is not translucent at all.  His long, pointed ears protrude from his head at a large angle, and his nose juts quite a distance from his face.  In spite of his comical appearance, he remains sinister, with a sly unfriendly expression.

mobs.long_desc: A small, shadowlike elf prepares to strike.
mobs.desc: With darkened clothing and brownish eyes, this little elf almost disappears into the long shadows of the forest.  His long ears almost flop as he moves, and his eyes jump from target to target with ruthless efficiency.

mobs.long_desc: A small, shadowlike elf moves in for the kill.
mobs.desc: The silent movements of this elf-like creature are frightening and deadly. She keeps to the shadows, never letting her eyes stray from her target. Subtle makeup darkens her already smoky complexion, and her bright yellow eyes peer between slitted lids.

mobs.long_desc: A shaggy, unkempt bear stumbles through the area.
mobs.desc: It is a smallish-sized brown bear with shaggy, unkempt fur that sticks out in alarming patches all over the creature's body. Its eyes are wild and its yellowed fangs drip a viscous clear fluid. It lumbers more than walks, stumbling from side to side as it careens through the area. Its paws are large for its size, but its claws are all jagged and filthy.

mobs.long_desc: A wolverine staggers by.
mobs.desc: It's a squat, muscular wolverine with a long muzzle and four stout legs that end in jagged claws. Its fur is spikey and terribly unkempt, and it blunders side-to-side with a drunken gait that gives it an erratic quality. Its eyes are wild and brown, bloodshot at the edges.

mobs.short_desc: a reddish squirrel of unusual size
mobs.long_desc: A reddish squirrel of unusual size chatters away here.
mobs.desc: Though overall this looks like a normal squirrel, it is abnormally large, with a genuinely malevolent aspect to its beady black eyes and its yellowed buck-teeth. Its size gives it a downright fearless demeanor. Its fur is reddish-brown, with tufts at its ears.

objects.ground: A brackish creek trickles through the forest.

extras.text: This little creek is cut off at both ends by decades or more of brambles decomposing into the niggardly soil. The water has a greenish film across its surface, though that is easily swept aside to reach the liquid beneath the algae.

objects.ground: A purple fruit grows in clusters in the trees.

extras.text: This fruit is about the size of a plum, with a hard rind that, once broken, reveals sweet, nearly alcoholic-tasting orange-pink flesh. Though it isn't large, fruit is supposed to be very good for growing adventurers, so eat up!

objects.ground: A delicious-smelling pastry's been lost here.

extras.text: Golden, buttery pastry crust forms a double-handful of some kind of handheld pie. You smell meat inside it, a little cool from its earlier baking, but still delicious.

objects.ground: A little silver deer-shaped charm shines on the ground.

extras.text: The charm is shaped into a little silver figurine of a deer, of a size suitable to put onto a lady's charm bracelet.  It dangles from a bit of chain, but not enough to wear around your neck, which is not a surprise.

objects.ground: A tasseled hood lies crumpled on the ground.

extras.text: The tasseled hood was once made of grey leather, though over time, the color was obscured into a kind of all-purpose light brown.  It's a simple two-piece conical sort of hood, coming to a point well above the wearer's crown and falling back.  A lively tassel made of leather fringe finishes the headgear.

objects.ground: A pair of steel cups nestled together lies here.

extras.text: These cups fit exactly around their wearer's shoulder, protecting it from the all-too-frequent blows that break through a fighter's defenses.  They're plain, with only an embossing around their edges as decoration.  Leather straps hold the spaulders tight against the shoulders and down part of the arm, criss-crossing at the chest and back.

objects.ground: A large, ornamented belt lies coiled here.

extras.text: This large, wide belt goes around the waist, up over the shoulders, to support a sword's sheath.  A lion rampant adorns the front of it, where it goes across the stomach.  The baldric seems very old; its owner hasn't taken good care of it -- the leather is cracked in places.

objects.ground: A black-and-white satin cape's been left here.

extras.text: This is no ordinary cape -- it's that special kind used in swordplay.  A fabric handle is sewn into its center, making it obvious that you hold it there. Those swirling folds of black and white satin would easily confound an opponent, allowing you to seize their weapon in the satin.

objects.ground: A pair of yellow leather boots stands in the corner.

extras.text: These butter-yellow boots look clunky and hard to walk in, but they tingle as you look at them.  You recognize them as that rarest of items, the Seven League Boots of legend.  Put them on!  See how much faster you move!

objects.ground: A mallet rests on its head against a wall.

extras.text: This mallet is simply made, with a oak wood shaft about the length of your forearm and a head made of many layers of rawhide pressed together and dried. It'd be useful for a handyman.

objects.ground: A long knife glints up at you.

extras.text: This knife's about as long as your forearm, a respectable length.  The tang of the knife is bound into a teak-wood hilt by way of steel rivets.  Dual thumb guards protect its wielder's digits from harm.

objects.short: a pair of kid leather gloves
objects.ground: Gloves made of a soft violet leather lie here.

extras.text: These soft gloves seem very feminine in nature, and they were obviously made with a lady in mind.  The purple-dyed leather is as delicate and soft as rose petals!  This handwear won't provide very good protection, but they're better than nothing.

objects.ground: A broken piece of seashell lies unnoticed in the grass.

extras.text: This bit of seashell is obviously a piece of a huge shell; you can tell by the size of the rills on its other side. The shard, vaguely conical in shape, fits comfortably in your hand. Now you just need to figure out where it could have come from.

objects.ground: A mud puddle is in the path.

extras.text: This puddle is about thigh-deep to you, and quite small for its depth! The brackish water welling up from the hole in the ground seems drinkable. Footprints nearby warn you that others in the area might find it so as well.

objects.ground: A very battered desk stands here.

extras.text: This desk is very old and in bad shape. It needs polishing very badly, and maybe a new paint job. One drawer seems to stick a little bit.
The drawer is on the side of the desk and seems as battered as the rest of it. It slides open as though it isn't sure it can remember how.

objects.ground: A pair of bark sleeves with woven designs is propped against a tree.

extras.text: These sleeves are woven with several kinds of bark: tough bark for protection against blows, sinewy for strength, and dense burr-like material to slow punctures.  On top of each forearm is the symbol of the Rhell tree: a large round flower with milky-white petals.  In addition, a single droplet of fluid is just falling from the tip of the lowest petal on each flower.

objects.ground: A short white whip made from fragments of bone lies here coiled.

extras.text: The handle of this whip is dark wood, while the lowest part of its tail is reinforced with several vertebra.  They appear to come from a medium-sized animal, perhaps the size of a deer.  The remainder is braided, bleached leather, except for three small fingerbones attached to the end.

objects.ground: A little brown cookie lies here begging to be eaten.

extras.text: The scents of sugar and oatmeal waft up from this very tasty-looking cookie. Perhaps a hint of acorn can be smelled as well?

objects.ground: A yellowish cookie lies here drying out.

extras.text: Nothing smells quite like the slightly burned sugar in a well-baked sugar cookie.  This one is bright yellow with a slight orange tinge where the sugar started to burn.  It smells delicious.

objects.ground: A small stoppered cup made entirely of bark lies on its side.

extras.text: An inner layer of soft, boiled bark is coiled around to make the watertight portion of this container.  The outer covering is a woven light-gray stiff bark, which protects the inner layer from damage.  Overall, it's a fair piece of craftsmanship.

objects.ground: A kestrel feather sits on the ground.

extras.text: Black on the top and white spotted with brown on the bottom, this handsome kestrel feather must have come from a large member of its species.  It's one of the wing feathers and would probably make a fine quill to scribe in a spellbook with.

objects.ground: A brass key glints up from the ground.

extras.text: It's just a simple brass key.

objects.ground: A small black iron key lies in the corner.

extras.text: This key looks rather old. Though protected from rust, it still suffers the ravages of age. Small flakes have been knocked off its surface.

objects.short: a key made of antler bone
objects.ground: A key made of antler bone threatens to poke you.

extras.text: It's clearly a piece of antler, with the horntip on one end and the other carved into the key part of the key.

objects.short: a key made of blackened wood
objects.ground: A key made from blackened wood lies here.

extras.text: This key's been made from a piece of the black and pitted wood typical of trees in the Twisted Forest near Mielikki.

objects.ground: A rough wooden key lies here.

extras.text: Perhaps this key is made of wood from the mighty rhell tree, or maybe just appears to be. The wood is red and hasn't been treated, but somehow it still appears to be in perfect condition, as if somebody had just made it this very day.

triggers.name: Hooded druid responds to 'hello'
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %actor.has_completed[twisted_sorrow]% bow %actor.name% wait 1s say Hello my friend.  The trees are still thankful for your service. else say Hello, little one. wait 2s mecho The hooded druid says, 'I take it you have witnessed the the devastation beyond mecho &0this grove?  A great evil befell the land, while we were sleeping.  Now that it mecho &0has consumed even the one who wrought it, what hope is there of lifting it? mecho &0Surely, I have no idea.' wait 5s sigh wait 2s mecho The hooded druid continues, 'But still, these trees are not so easily mecho &0perverted.  Though the corruption of the forest has harmed and saddened them, mecho &0they live on.  And indeed, they thirst, each in its own way.  But it has been mecho &0so long since they were slaked, that none can remember what satisfies them.' wait 5s mecho The hooded druid says, 'Tell me friend, do you think you may want to help mecho &0them?' end

triggers.name: Druid responds to 'yes'
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %actor.has_completed[twisted_sorrow]% smile %actor.name% wait 1s say The trees are satisfied, my friend. else msend %actor% %self.name% looks over you carefully. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% looks over %actor.name% carefully. wait 2s mecho The hooded druid says, 'You seem the bright sort, and I sense some compassion mecho &0in you.  If you can muster the kindness to minister to the sorrow that these mecho &0trees bear, who knows what good shall follow?  Surely, the curse upon this mecho &0forest cannot so easily be lifted, but still, kind deeds never go wasted in mecho &0this world.' wait 5s emote thinks deeply for a moment. wait 2s mecho The hooded druid asks, 'So: would you care to ease the loneliness of the mecho &0Rhells?  If you wish to do so, say &7&b"I will assist"&0.' end

triggers.name: Druid responds to 'assist'
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %actor.has_completed[twisted_sorrow]% smile %actor.name% wait 1s say The trees are satisfied, my friend. else if %actor.quest_stage[twisted_sorrow]% == 0 quest start twisted_sorrow %actor.name% endif mecho The hooded druid says, 'Very well.  Each tree sups of its own liquid, that much mecho &0I know.  But what specifically they desire, I'm afraid, is knowledge from mecho &0before I began my watch.' wait 5 s emote rubs his forehead thoughtfully. wait 2 s mecho The hooded druid says, 'A prayer of greeting must be spoken to each tree mecho &0before it will awaken, so you will need my help.  Here is what you must do.' wait 5 s emote looks sharply to ensure that you are paying attention. wait 2 s mecho The hooded druid says, 'When you have a liquid to offer, say in my presence, mecho &0&7&b"follow me"&0.  Then I will accompany you to whichever tree you have chosen. mecho &0Then go to the tree, and give me the vessel.  I will commune with the tree and mecho &0provide it with the offering.' wait 5 s emote stops to cough a few times, and leans up against a tree for support. wait 2 s mecho The hooded druid says, 'Now go, and return when you have what is needed.' end

triggers.name: Druid receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[twisted_sorrow]% > 1 return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% gives %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. wait 8 say No further offerings are necessary. msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to %actor.name%. elseif %actor.quest_stage[twisted_sorrow]% == 1 if %object.type% == LIQCONTAINER if %self.room% == 12015 return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% gives %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. wait 4 say Let us move to one of the mighty Rhells first, friend. wait 4 msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to %actor.name%. else if %object.val1% == 0 return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% gives %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. wait 4 emote peers into %object.shortdesc%. wait 4 say This won't do at all!  It's empty. wait 4 msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to %actor.name%. elseif %actor.quest_variable[twisted_sorrow:satisfied_tree:%self.room%]% == 1 return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% gives %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. wait 4 say This tree is already satisfied, my friend. wait 4 msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to %actor.name%. else return 1 wait 1 s emote peers into %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 s nod wait 2 s kneel emote places his hands on the mighty Rhell's roots. wait 5 s emote continues to kneel, making no sound. wait 7 s stand set success 0 * The tree of Luck: tea if %self.room% == 12016 && %object.val2% == 11 set success 1 * The tree of Reverence: moderate alcohol elseif %self.room% == 12017 && %object.val2% > 0 && %object.val2% < 5 set success 1 * The tree of self-reliance: water elseif %self.room% == 12018 && %object.val2% == 0 set success 1 * The tree of nimbleness: coffee elseif %self.room% == 12014 && %object.val2% == 12 set success 1 * The tree of kindness: milk elseif %self.room% == 12046 && %object.val2% == 10 set success 1 end mecho %self.name% carefully pours out %object.shortdesc% onto the Rhell's roots. wait 1 mjunk %object.name% wait 8 if %success% == 1 eval num_trees 1 + %actor.quest_variable[twisted_sorrow:num_trees]% quest variable twisted_sorrow %actor.name% num_trees %num_trees% quest variable twisted_sorrow %actor.name% satisfied_tree:%self.room% 1 mecho A deep throbbing hum is emanating from the ground. wait 3 s mecho The hum gets louder and louder, causing twigs and leaves to dance upon the ground! mecho It is overwhelming, yet soothing. wait 5 s mecho The hum fades slowly away, and all is quiet again. wait 3 s smile wait 2 s if %num_trees% < 4 say You have done this tree a great service. elseif %num_trees% == 4 say I sense that yet another tree waits in loneliness. wait 1s say There can be no peace until it, too, is satisfied. elseif %num_trees% == 5 say Excellent, my friend!  The trees are satisfied. wait 8 say Please take this gift on their behalf. wait 8 mload obj 12018 give sleeves-sorrow %actor.name% follow me wait 4 emote walks away quietly. quest complete twisted_sorrow %actor.name% * * Set X to the level of the award - code does not run without it * if %actor.level% < 10 set expcap %actor.level% else set expcap 10 endif set expmod 0 if %expcap% < 9 eval expmod (((%expcap% * %expcap%) + %expcap%) / 2) * 55 elseif %expcap% < 17 eval expmod 440 + ((%expcap% - 8) * 125) elseif %expcap% < 25 eval expmod 1440 + ((%expcap% - 16) * 175) elseif %expcap% < 34 eval expmod 2840 + ((%expcap% - 24) * 225) elseif %expcap% < 49 eval expmod 4640 + ((%expcap% - 32) * 250) elseif %expcap% < 90 eval expmod 8640 + ((%expcap% - 48) * 300) else eval expmod 20940 + ((%expcap% - 89) * 600) endif * * Adjust exp award by class so all classes receive the same proportionate amount * switch %actor.class% case Warrior case Berserker * * 110% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 10)) break case Paladin case Anti-Paladin case Ranger * * 115% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + ((%expmod% * 2) / 15) break case Sorcerer case Pyromancer case Cryomancer case Illusionist case Bard * * 120% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 5)) break case Necromancer case Monk * * 130% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% * 2) / 5) break default set expmod %expmod% done msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 eval setexp (%expmod% * 10) set loop 0 while %loop% < 10 * * Xexp must be replaced by mexp, oexp, or wexp for this code to work * Pick depending on what is running the trigger * mexp %actor% %expmod% eval loop %loop% + 1 done mteleport %self% 12015 end else sigh wait 8 say The tree is not responding. wait 1s say I fear it has little liking for that drink. end * Here is where the object could be returned, if a way to * empty it could be devised. end end else return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% gives %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. wait 4 say This is not a liquid container. wait 4 msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to %actor.name%. end else return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% gives %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. wait 8 say Why do you give me this? msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to %actor.name%. end

triggers.name: Druid responds to 'follow'
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[twisted_sorrow]% == 1 wait 4 emote nods solemnly. wait 8 follow %actor.name% end

triggers.name: Druid is prevented from going up
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == 12018 return 0 end

triggers.name: Haggard brownie greets
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 && %self.room% == 12103 wait 3 emote looks at you with desperation. wait 8 set room %get.room[%self.room%]% if (%room.people[12020]%) say Please, help me escape from these fiends! wait 3 s mforce dark-pixie-tormentor slap haggard-brownie mforce dark-pixie-tormentor emote hisses, 'It will be ssssilent!' wait 2 s emote cringes away, uttering a little yelp. else say I am so lost!  Will you help me get home? say Say 'I will escort you' if so.  But beware! say The forces of darkness hunt me... wait 4 s scan end end

triggers.name: Dark pixies torment brownie
triggers.commands: if (%self.people[12019]%) && (%self.people[12020]%) switch %random.5% case 1 wforce dark-pixie-tormentor emote hisses, 'Where is your forest magic now, tree-turd?' break case 2 wforce dark-pixie-tormentor emote growls, 'Tell us why you intrude, clod... and we may slay you swiftly.' break case 3 wforce dark-pixie-tormentor emote swiftly kicks the haggard brownie in the kidney. break case 4 wforce dark-pixie-tormentor emote hisses, 'You sicken me, dirty-skin.' break default wecho Snap!  A dark pixie raises another welt on the haggard brownie's arm. done wait 8 switch %random.4% case 1 wforce haggard-brownie emote whimpers piteously. break case 2 wforce haggard-brownie emote glares resentfully at a dark pixie. break case 3 wforce haggard-brownie emote bites his lip, though a tear seems to be forming in his eye. break default wforce haggard-brownie emote covers his head with his arms, moaning, 'No!' done end

triggers.name: Check whether brownie freed from tormentors
triggers.commands: wait 3 if (%self.people[12019]%) && !(%self.people[12020]%) * This means that the pixies have been slayed, and the haggard brownie can be rescued. wait 8 wforce haggard-brownie say Thank goodness!  You've killed them! wait 3 s wforce haggard-brownie say I must return home... but there will be others... wait 3 s wforce haggard-brownie say Please friend, help me!  If you can take me home, my family wforce haggard-brownie say will surely reward you!  And if you will do this thing, just wforce haggard-brownie say say 'I will escort you' and I will follow. end

triggers.name: Dark pixie tormentor dies
triggers.commands: if %self.room% == 12103 m_run_room_trig 12008 end

triggers.name: Haggard brownie hears 'escort'
triggers.commands: set rescuer %actor.name% global rescuer if %self.room% != 12103 && %self.room% != 12095 && %self.room% != 12030 wait 4 follow %actor.name% end

triggers.name: Someone says 'escort' in torture room
triggers.commands: return 0 if (%self.people[12019]%) && !(%self.people[12020]%) wforce haggard-brownie nod %actor.name% wforce haggard-brownie say Please take me back to the light forest! wait 8 wforce haggard-brownie follow %actor.name% elseif (%self.people[12019]%) && (%self.people[12020]%) wforce dark-pixie-tormentor snicker wait 2 s wforce dark-pixie-tormentor say Stay out of this, grain-eater. end

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: Nothing.

triggers.name: Dark pixies ambush
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == 12019 wait 1 wforce haggard-brownie follow me wait 3 if %self.vnum% == 12030 wforce haggard-brownie mload obj 12001 wforce haggard-brownie mat 12050 drop passionfruit else wforce haggard-brownie mload obj 12002 wforce haggard-brownie mat 12050 drop meat-pie end wecho &9&bDark shadows&0 move swiftly toward the haggard brownie. end

triggers.name: Someone says 'escort' in an ambush room 95
triggers.commands: return 0 wait 4 if (%self.people[12019]%) && !(%self.people[12021]%) && !(%self.people[12022]%) wforce haggard-brownie nod %actor.name% wforce haggard-brownie say Please take me back to the light forest! wait 8 wforce haggard-brownie follow %actor.name% elseif (%self.people[12019]%) && ((%self.people[12021]%) || (%self.people[12022]%)) wforce haggard-brownie emote glances fearfully at a dark pixie. end

triggers.name: Someone says 'escort' in an ambush room 30
triggers.commands: return 0 wait 4 if (%self.people[12019]%) && !(%self.people[12021]%) && !(%self.people[12022]%) wforce haggard-brownie nod %actor.name% wforce haggard-brownie say Please take me back to the light forest! wait 8 wforce haggard-brownie follow %actor.name% elseif (%self.people[12019]%) && ((%self.people[12021]%) || (%self.people[12022]%)) wforce haggard-brownie emote glances fearfully at a dark pixie. end

triggers.name: Drop trigger for ambush staging room
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == 12019 wait 1 set direction d set destination 12030 if %object.vnum% == 12002 set direction u set destination 12095 end wpurge %object% if (%self.people[12021]%) wforce dark-pixie-ambusher-male %direction% wait 1 wat %destination% wforce dark-pixie-ambusher-male kill haggard-brownie end if (%self.people[12022]%) wforce dark-pixie-ambusher-female %direction% wait 1 wat %destination% wforce dark-pixie-ambusher-female kill haggard-brownie end done

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: Nothing.

triggers.name: Push aside planking
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case p case pu return 0 halt done if %arg% /= planking set planking_open 1 global planking_open wdoor 12093 south room 12039 wdoor 12093 south description The broken planking hangs askew. wdoor 12093 south name planking wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% pushes aside some planking on the south wall. wsend %actor% You push aside some planking, revealing an opening to the south. wat 12039 wecho Some planks in the wall are swung aside. wait 5 s wecho The planking swings back down. wdoor 12093 south purge set planking_open 0 global planking_open else return 0 endif

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: return 0

triggers.name: Message about planking
triggers.commands: if %direction% == south && %planking_open% != 1 wait 3 wsend %actor% As you enter, a bit of planking falls back, obscuring the opening to the south. wsend %actor% It looks like you could push it aside, should the need arise. end

triggers.name: Haggard brownie reaches safety
triggers.commands: if %destination% == 12000 follow me wait 4 say Thank you!  Thank you at last I am safe! mexp %rescuer% 15000 msend %rescuer% You gain experience! wait 2 s say Ah, here is the travel pack I lost in that wretched forest. emote rummages in the pack for a few moments. mload obj 12020 mload obj 12020 mload obj 12021 mload obj 12022 wait 4 s say Please take this.  It's not much, but it is all I can spare at the moment. wait 2 s give all.cookie %rescuer% give cup %rescuer% drop all.cookie drop cup wait 2 s say Goodbye now! emote trots off into the undergrowth. mpurge self end

triggers.name: unused trigger
triggers.commands: mecho OOO - avnum=%actor.vnum% -- give all %rescuer% wait 8 if %actor.vnum% == 12019 give all %rescuer% end

triggers.name: twisted_sorrow_status_tracker
triggers.commands: set luck %actor.quest_variable[twisted_sorrow:satisfied_tree:12016]% set reverence %actor.quest_variable[twisted_sorrow:satisfied_tree:12017]% set reliance %actor.quest_variable[twisted_sorrow:satisfied_tree:12018]% set nimbleness %actor.quest_variable[twisted_sorrow:satisfied_tree:12014]% set kindness %actor.quest_variable[twisted_sorrow:satisfied_tree:12046]% set tree1 %get.room[12016]% set tree2 %get.room[12017]% set tree3 %get.room[12018]% set tree4 %get.room[12014]% set tree5 %get.room[12046]% wait 4 if %actor.quest_stage[twisted_sorrow]% > 1 smile %actor.name% wait 1 s say The trees are satisfied, my friend. elseif %actor.quest_stage[twisted_sorrow]% == 1 say Bring drink to awaken the trees from the corruption. if (%luck% == 1 || %reverence% == 1 || %reliance% == 1 || %nimbleness% == 1 || %kindness% == 1) mecho mecho You have already awakened the following trees: if %luck% == 1 mecho - &9&b%tree1.name%&0 endif if %reverence% == 1 mecho - &9&b%tree2.name%&0 endif if %reliance% == 1 mecho - &9&b%tree3.name%&0 endif if %nimbleness% == 1 mecho - &9&b%tree4.name%&0 endif if %kindness% == 1 mecho - &9&b%tree5.name%&0 endif endif mecho mecho Offerings are still needed for: if %luck% == 0 mecho - &2%tree1.name%&0 endif if %reverence% == 0 mecho - &2%tree2.name%&0 endif if %reliance% == 0 mecho - &2%tree3.name%&0 endif if %nimbleness% == 0 mecho - &2%tree4.name%&0 endif if %kindness% == 0 mecho - &2%tree5.name%&0 endif mecho &0 say Say &6&b"follow me"&0 when you have an offering to present. endif

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: A sudden shift in attitude about this forest gives you cause for immediate concern.  The forest to the north is merely dark, but here it feels downright malevolent.  The oppressive darkness isn't quite so pervading here, allowing you a moment's respite to see the danger to the south.

North.description: To the north, you see the darkening forest.

South.description: The evil forest trail continues.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Evil-looking, black-trunked trees seem to lean in toward you with almost malevolent intent.  The path is little more than a broken trail, and barely that, leading into the darkness.  It twists and curves through the undergrowth, going north and east.

North.description: The path continues.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Evil-looking, black-trunked trees seem to lean in toward you with almost malevolent intent.  The path is little more than a broken trail, and barely that, leading into the darkness.

West.description: The path curves out of sight.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Evil-looking, black-trunked trees seem to lean in toward you with almost malevolent intent.  The path is little more than a broken trail, and barely that, leading into the darkness.

South.description: The path twists out of sight.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Ashen trunks crowd in upon the path as it swings east, avoiding massive Rhell trees to the south.  The Rhells are, of course, quite huge.  The darkness lies like a fog of ignorance on the ground, and it is impossible to see anything very far off.

North.description: The path continues.

West.description: The path continues.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: The path runs east-west through the blank-trunked trees.  A vast briar patch lies to the south, treacherous-looking and impenetrable.  Evil, black trees impede movement to the north and south.  The ponderous trunk of a giant Rhell is visible to the southwest.

East.description: The path continues.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Sunlight never seems to fully penetrate this forest.  At best, dim light sometimes reaches through the Spanish moss and the black branches of the evil-looking trees.  Though the forest continues in all directions, the briars block all exit possibilities save those to the east and west.

West.description: The path continues.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: To the south is a vast briar patch.  It's incredibly dangerous looking, with thorns the size of a newt, and no way in.  Black trees that block out the sunlight stand everywhere, their branches grabbing and catching at everything within reach.  A light path meanders along heading east and west.

East.description: The path continues.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Vicious brambles and thorns protrude threateningly into the path.  They engulf a forest of blackened, contorted trees.  A noiseless breeze creeps through the low branches, bringing the scent of death and ashes.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: This evil, black forest seems always in perpetual twilight.  The bare, crackling dark branches almost seem to be reaching out in hunger.  There is little sun here, and the dark dusty leaves are parched with thirst.

North.description: You see a trail to the north.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Bare, flame-blackened trees stretch to the heavens, their dark, scratchy branches intermingling in a kind of greasy net to keep any kind sunshine or moonlight from reaching the ground.  A deep sense of shame and foreboding seems to mark this forest.  A tiny path sweeps through the undergrowth.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: No kind winds reach the ground of this burned, blackened forest.  Once, long ago, the trees might have been mighty, but now, they are husks, with ash-coated bark that scrapes off easily.  A tiny path meanders through, avoiding fiendish thorns and clinging twigs.

West.description: The only way to go so far is to the west, through the brambles.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Tall, twisted trunks that twine around each other as though forced to by some bizarre magic seem to loom in over the path, forcing it to zig and zag to avoid them.  There is no undergrowth, no vegetation, aside from some lethal-seeming brambles that crowd to the west.  Massive trees stand to the south, unmistakably Rhells.  It is impossible to see beyond them.

East.description: The forest extends eastward, through the brambles.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: A thick briar patch with vicious thorns grows among the twisted and blackened trunks of this forest.  A tiny path, barely suitable for mounts, passes along a mighty Rhell to the south.

rooms.name: The Western Tree of Nimbleness
rooms.description: Here is a kind of altar made of branches and brambles, set up at the base of a huge rhell tree.  Time has obliterated any offerings set up on the ersatz altar, though it's easy to see that this tree, one of the four biggest in the entire forest, holds some special respect.

East.description: You hear the sounds of water, and see a black, shadowy pond.

Up.description: Upwards, you see a way of climbing the tree.

extras.text: Ancient etchings trace the edge of the altar's surface.  The letters are old and worn, barely legible after all these ages.  They read:&_ "Ah! A nimble mind and wakened body. Truly coffee is a gift of the spirit."

rooms.name: Before the Waters of Sorrow
rooms.description: In a quiet little grove, this pond faces the four biggest trees imaginable. Perhaps the water, brackish and stagnant though it is, keeps the mighty rhells alive.  Perhaps it is a place of religious importance, though if it is, it was abandoned long ago.  The air is quiet and expectant; even the brambles are nowhere in sight, as if reluctant to intrude.

North.description: You see a singularly large tree to the north.

East.description: You see a singularly large tree to the east.

South.description: You see a singularly large tree to the south.

West.description: You see a singularly large tree to the west.

extras.text: The trees are mighty beyond all comprehension.  Dried graying moss clings to the bark, but they are otherwise untouched by any sign of corruption.  Lesser trees do crowd around their bases.  Perhaps seeking a drink from the precious water that flows here, but none intrude into this central place.  The massive Rhell trees seem to stretch up beyond the reach of vision.

rooms.name: The Northern Tree of Luck
rooms.description: A kind of altar is built up against the massive root system of the tree, which even for a rhell is massive.  There are no offerings, though; perhaps they were stolen or decayed through time into the black soil.  To the south, a creek or pond of some kind is visible.

South.description: You see a grown-over pond to the south.

Up.description: Gazing upward, you spy a way to climb the massive tree.

extras.text: Ancient etchings trace the edge of the altar's surface.  The letters are old and worn, barely legible after all these ages.  They read:&_ "If a man has no tea in him, he is incapable of understanding truth and beauty."

rooms.name: The Eastern Tree of Reverence
rooms.description: A quiet little grove centers around this mighty tree, which is unmistakably a rhell.  Even for a rhell tree, it's huge, a monster.  Roots rise up from the soil here and there; someone long ago set up a kind of altar on them, using branches and broad black leaves from some other species of tree.

West.description: You see a grown-over pond.

Up.description: Looking up the vast trunk, you realize you could climb it.

extras.text: Ancient etchings trace the edge of the altar's surface.  The letters are old and worn, barely legible after all these ages.  They read:&_ "When ale thou quaffest, call upon earth's might - 'tis earth drinks in the floods."

rooms.name: The Southern Tree of Self-Reliance
rooms.description: A magical aura pervades the otherwise threatening-seeming forest, which is burned by fire and starved of sunshine.  But this rhell tree is both mighty and vigorous; it might live another millennium, in addition to the one it has doubtless already lived.  An ancient, decaying altar has been built near its base.  The altar is empty and has clearly not been used for some time.

North.description: You see a long-abandoned pond.

Up.description: Looking up the ancient trunk of the tree, you see a way to climb up it.

extras.text: Ancient etchings trace the edge of the altar's surface.  The letters are old and worn, barely legible after all these ages.  They read:&_ "Water is the most perfect traveller because when it travels it becomes the path itself!"

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Tall, twisted trunks that twine around each other as though forced to by some bizarre magic seem to loom in toward the path, forcing it to wend its way carefully between them.  There is no undergrowth, no vegetation, aside from some lethal-seeming brambles that crowd to the southwest, preventing passage. A grove of mighty Rhell trees lies impenetrable to the northwest.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: A light path creeps along the discarded bark of twisted trees.  Mighty Rhells loom to the northwest, surrounded by brambles with vicious thorns.  The sounds of the forest are muted, and there is little movement of the air.

North.description: Nothing.

West.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted forest Path
rooms.description: Tall twisted trunks loom over the path, entwined around each other as though by some bizarre magic.  Their dark canopies block the sunlight from reaching the forest floor.  Lethal-looking brambles grow all around, right up to a wall of tall Rhell trees to the north.  The dark gray bark of tortured trees surrounds the path.

East.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: A grove of Rhell trees stands impenetrable to the northeast.  Here, a small path skirts the edge of the grove, clinging to a small zone where the evil brambles thin.  Twisted trees grow all around, their canopies blocking out the light of the sun.  There is a building of some sort far off to the southwest. Strangely silent, the forest seems to drip with malevolence.

extras.text: It is quite some distance to the southwest.  From here, it is only possible to determine that it rises a single story, and that it is in a state of disrepair.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Mighty Rhell trees grow in a thick stand to the northeast.  Brambles grow right up to them, though they seem inhibited by the Rhells' presence.  A path wanders along the edge of the grove, avoiding the worst of the brambles and their cruel thorns.  Tall, twisted, gray trees grow thick all around.

South.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Tall, twisted trunks that twine around each other as though forced to by some bizarre magic seem to loom in toward the path, forcing it to wend and jog to avoid them.  There is no undergrowth, no vegetation, aside from some lethal-seeming brambles.  The brambles are stunted here, as if inhibited by friendly magic, and indeed none are visible to the north.

North.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: A Quiet Side Path
rooms.description: The muted sounds of the forest are more audible here: the song of a bird, the chittering of a rodent, and the burbling sound of running water echo faintly through the air.  A giant Rhell tree stands to the east, and the twisted undergrowth of this blighted forest grows impentrably to the west.  A light path leads north and south.

North.description: Nothing.

South.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: A Quiet Nook
rooms.description: A light breeze flows through the air.  An expanse of grass grows here between Rhell trees to the east and twisted, stunted hardwoods to the west.  A few saplings, unmistakably Rhells, yearn for the sunlight far overhead.

South.description: Nothing.

extras.text: The young rhells are brave, but their elder siblings demonstrate the difficulty of surviving long in these woods.  The larger the Rhell, the sicklier it is (excluding the mighty adults), and no young Rhell is taller than fifty feet, save a few lifeless husks.  Nevertheless, a few small saplings strive vigorously.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: The path makes its careful way through a giant briar patch.  Vicious thorns stick out like daggers.  The high canopy of twisted and tortured trees looms overhead, with tangled black branches blocking the sky.

East.description: The forest extends east through the brambles.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: A path, running through evil brambles to the east, swings south here.  A few Rhell trees stand off to the northwest, out of reach.  The path is lightly traveled but shows some signs of maintenance.  Some low-lying twisted branches are tattered, as if they had been repeatedly climbed.

South.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Tall, twisted trunks that twine around each other as though forced to by some bizarre magic seem to loom in toward you, forcing you left and right to avoid them.  There is no undergrowth, no vegetation, aside from some lethal-seeming brambles.

East.description: The forest extends eastward, through the brambles.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Tall, twisted trunks that twine around each other as though forced to by some bizarre magic seem to loom in toward you, forcing you left and right to avoid them.  There is no undergrowth, no vegetation, aside from some lethal-seeming brambles.

West.description: The forest extends westward, through the brambles.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Dark, malevolently twisted tree branches, devoid of life and brittle with age, block most directions in this formless forest.  Ancient brambles further impede progress with their thorns and underfoot vines.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Dark, malevolently twisted tree branches, devoid of life and brittle with age, block most directions in this formless forest.  Ancient brambles further impede progress with their thorns and underfoot vines.  They form an impassable barrier to the north, and another cluster grows to the southeast.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Dark, malevolently twisted tree branches, devoid of life and brittle with age, block most directions in this formless forest.  Ancient brambles further impede progress with their thorns and underfoot vines.  The tracks of woodland creatures pepper the ground.

North.description: The forest extends northward, through brambles.

extras.text: The tracks of deer are easily seen, along with smaller less clear impressions. Bootprints, fairly common on the path to the south, are much less common here.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: This is a quiet, wicked forest of blackened, burned trees.  To the east is something marvelous: huge trees forming a long north-south line of massive, unburned trunks that seem out of place in this evil, ancient forest of smaller, malevolent trees and blackened brambles.  A blueish mist is drifting in from the west.  There is something odd about the tracks on the ground.

extras.text: The mist curls up in loose tendrils, to the west, in a roughly parallel north-south path that lies within view, though depressed into the ground slightly.  Perhaps there is a cliff near there, and the path is below that. That is the only explanation you can think of for the light blue mist, which seems magical in nature.

There are as many tracks on the ground here as elsewhere, and bootprints can be seen here and there.  But while there is nothing strange about the animal tracks, the bootprints seem to be traveling in a loop - as if the traveler tended to enter from the south, but usually turn back again.  There is no obvious reason for this behavior.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A thinning in the forest allows passage through this area, though no path is visible.  Beyond some animal pens to the east, a weathered building of some sort is visible.  Stunted briars grow all around, beneath the dark gray bark of twisted trees.

North.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: The darkness of this forest is oppressive.  Massive twining branches curl overhead with evil intent.  Movement is difficult, even with the lack of undergrowth.  There seems to be a more open area far to the south, though it is unreachable from here.  A fresh breeze blows in, as well.

East.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Sunlight never seems to fully penetrate this forest at best, dim light sometimes reaches through the Spanish moss and the black branches of the evil-looking trees.  Though the forest continues in all directions, it would seem impossible to go anywhere except south and west.

West.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: This is a sparse pine forest with gnarled trunks growing from sandy hills. Gray-barked hardwoods grow to the north.  An ancient building, dilapidated but holding together, looms far to the northeast.  The scent of the sea sits lightly on the breeze.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: This is a mixture of dark, broadleaved trees and twisted sea-pines.  The forest grows right up to the wall of an aging structure to the north.  Its darkened planks are stained with water and lichens.  The scent of the sea is unmistakable.

North.description: The wall of the building looks like it can be moved.

East.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A low fence lies to the east, and a small building is off to the northeast. A larger structure looms to the northwest.  Like the buildings, the fence is in a state of disrepair.  Vines and brambles cover it, while stunted sea-pines and twisted oaks grow everywhere.

West.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: The forest is dark and silent.  Ashen flakes fall from the bark of the tall, twisted trees and form a crackly layer beneath the ubiquitous briars.  A tiny path skirts a massive Rhell tree to the southwest, weaving and turning through the thick undergrowth.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Vicious brambles and thorns threaten to engulf the path.  They stand silently beneath a forest of blackened, contorted trees.  An awesome stand of massive Rhell trees grows to the southwest.  The light path seems to be skirting them.

North.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: To the southwest is a mighty stand of Rhell trees.  Contorted briars with cruel thorns crowd all around.  Lesser trees with convoluted trunks and blackened bark form an impenetrable canopy.  Little sunlight reaches this path. The path leads south and west.

South.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: To the west, mighty Rhells loom high above the rest of this stunted forest. The everpresent brambles are somewhat thinner here.  A hint of moisture, laden with the scent of decaying plants, drifts along on a lazy breeze from the east. The path simply continues around the Rhell trees.

North.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: A light path makes its tortuous way through the cruelly-armed brambles.  To the northwest stands an impenetrable grove of Rhell trees, which tower above the rest of this twisted, tortured forest.  Little sound is heard, for the drifts of graying bark and sullen air absorb any noise.

North.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: The Forgotten Tree of Kindness
rooms.description: Silent darkness sits at the foot of an ancient tree.  It is a Rhell like the others, slenderer but just as tall.  Where the others are strong, this one is graceful, even as it stands shrouded in impenetrable shadows.  Like the others, it has an altar; but this one is tiny, and made of living branches.

South.description: Nothing.

extras.text: Ancient etchings trace the edge of the altar's surface.  The letters are old and worn, barely legible after all these ages.  They read:&_ "Yet do I fear thy nature; it is too full o' the milk of human kindness to catch the nearest way."

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: There are huge trees to the east, but evil-looking briars stand in the way. The dark, threatening-looking trees look almost burned black, but there is no evidence of a fire.  A light blue mist drifts in from the west.  Dark shadows fall over all.

South.description: Nothing.

rooms.name: A Vale of Rhell Trees
rooms.description: A dark and tangled clump of thornbushes clusters to the east, beneath the mighty trunk of a rhell tree.  The light path leads north and south through the twisted trunks.  A blue mist drifts in from the west, smelling of the earth, and something otherworldly.  Many tracks are evident on the ground, along with some bootprints.

North.description: Nothing.

South.description: Nothing.

extras.text: The dry ground is somewhat dusty, so the prints of larger creatures can be seen.  The tracks of deer are particularly obvious.  There are plenty of bootprints too, going both north and south along the path.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Bare, flame-blackened trees stretch to the heavens, their dark, scratchy branches intermingling in a kind of greasy net to keep any kind of sunshine or moonlight from reaching the ground.  A deep sense of shame and foreboding seems to mark this forest.  Far to the west, you can see a kind of blue mist, but it is far beyond the worst of the brambles.

North.description: Nothing.

South.description: Nothing.

extras.text: The mist curls up in loose tendrils, to the west, in a roughly parallel north-south path that lies within view, though depressed into the ground slightly.  Perhaps there is a cliff near there, and the path is below that. That is the only explanation you can think of for the light blue mist, which seems magical in nature.
Animal tracks crisscross the ground.  Among them are the prints of heavy boots, traveling in both directions.

rooms.name: Ambush staging room
rooms.description: A quiet nook in the forest here allows assassins to wait quietly.

rooms.name: A Cradle of Rhell Trees
rooms.description: Several trees stand apart enough from the smaller, blacker trees for you to get a good look at them.  These trees are immense -- if you could cut any of them down, you could hold a dance on the top of its trunk!  Vines and little plants grow out of their rough bark here and there.  For some reason, the malevolence that surrounds you everywhere else in this evil forest seems less threatening here.

North.description: You see a dark, evil forest to the north.

East.description: The rhells extend eastward a bit.

West.description: More rhell trees, mighty and majestic, rise to the west.

Up.description: You can climb right up the tree.

rooms.name: A Cradle of Rhell Trees
rooms.description: Several trees stand apart enough from the smaller, blacker trees for you to get a good look at them.  These trees are immense -- if you could cut any of them down, you could hold a dance on the top of its trunk!  Vines and little plants grow out of their rough bark here and there.  For some reason, the malevolence that surrounds you everywhere else in this evil forest seems less threatening here.

East.description: The rhells extend eastward a bit.

Up.description: You can climb right up the tree.

rooms.name: A Cradle of Rhell Trees
rooms.description: Several trees stand apart enough from the smaller, blacker trees for you to get a good look at them.  These trees are immense -- if you could cut any of them down, you could hold a dance on the top of its trunk!  Vines and little plants grow out of their rough bark here and there.  For some reason, the malevolence that surrounds you everywhere else in this evil forest seems less threatening here.

West.description: To the west, you see another of the giant rhell trees.

Up.description: You can climb right up the tree.

rooms.name: A Clearing in the Twisted Forest
rooms.description: This peculiar clearing has no grass in it, because the blackened, twisted trees all around seem to bend inward to keep any sunshine from reaching the forest floor.  Some pine trees are intermingling with the rest; they are short and stunted, but pines nonetheless.  The scent of the sea drifts in from the south.

North.description: The forest extends northward.

West.description: The forest extends westward.

rooms.name: A Clearing in the Twisted Forest
rooms.description: The brambles and blackened trees seem a little thinner right here, allowing you to see in three different directions.  All of the options seem uniformly unpleasant.

North.description: The forest extends northward.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A weird bluish glow seems to emanate from the ground itself in this peculiarly evil forest.  The strange light doesn't seem benevolent in the least.  In fact, it makes this creepy forest seem all the more so.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

South.description: The glowing trees extend southward, as well.

rooms.name: The Edge of the Twisted Forest
rooms.description: The oaks and maples of this forest are becoming more scarce as the ground gets sandier.  Hardy little pine trees grow here and there, soaking up the salt-scented mist.  A light mist permeates the air.  To the west, it has a distinct blue tint.

North.description: The forest extends northward.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: A Sandy Hill
rooms.description: Gnarled sea pines grow on a low sandy hill.  Sparse patches of sea grass grow here and there, but mostly on the east, away from the patches of blue fog that threaten to encroach from the west.  A few twisted black oak trees are trying to grow here.  A steep drop prevents eastward movement, but it is possible to stagger down the southern slope of the hill through the deep sand. The smell of salt is strong.

West.description: The only way out that you can see is to the west.

extras.text: The fog is clearly of supernatural origin. Its evil nature is obvious to you; nothing this thick and mysterious can be here for any good reason.

rooms.name: A Sandy Ridge
rooms.description: This is the top of a low, sandy ridge.  The sea is visible to the southwest beyond a small wooden jetty.  Twisted pines grow along the ridge, their stunted trunks quite at home in the cool salty spray.  A path leads down to the east toward a sandy beach.

North.description: The blue-glowing forest extends northward.

extras.text: The fog is clearly of supernatural origin. Its evil nature is obvious to you; nothing this thick and mysterious can be here for any good reason.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Evil, twisted black trees contort in unknowable pain.  Their thorned branches seem to reach out toward you, as if they would devour you.  The ground has no grass on it, just bare packed dirt covered with mosses and vile-smelling brambles.

North.description: The forest extends northward.

West.description: The forest extends westward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Evil, twisted black trees contort in unknowable pain.  Their thorned branches seem to reach out toward you, as if they would devour you.  The ground has no grass on it, just bare packed dirt covered with mosses and vile-smelling brambles.

East.description: The forest ends to the east. Not far away, you can see some delapidated animal pens.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: Up Against Animal Pens
rooms.description: The forest to the west has thinned out here, to the point that the bare, packed dirt forest floor is plainly visible.  Ancient leaves crackle underfoot here and there.  This clearing continues to the north.  A ramshackle fence to the east halfheartedly guards an animal pen that's obviously seen better days.

North.description: The clearing continues.

West.description: The forest looms, black and evil, to the west.

rooms.name: Up Against Animal Pens
rooms.description: The forest to the west has thinned out here, to the point that the bare, packed dirt forest floor is plainly visible.  Ancient leaves crackle underfoot here and there.  This clearing continues to the south.  To the east, past a delapidated fence, what was once some kind of animal pen can be seen.

South.description: The clearing continues to the south.

West.description: The forest begins, and seems to extend west for a ways.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path, Curving Past Black Trees
rooms.description: Evil black trees crowd around you, barely leaving a thin path running to the north and east.  The air is thick with the scent of rotting plants and wet bark, and there is little noise.

North.description: The forest extends northward.

East.description: The forest extends eastward. Somewhere further along you see a fence protecting a path.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Evil black trees crowd around you, barely leaving a thin path running to the south and east.  The air is thick with the scent of rotting plants and wet bark, and there is little noise.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest Path
rooms.description: Brambles and thorns adorn the black, twisted trunks of the wizened trees all around.  The air smells and feels very moist, but the ground is fairly solid on the path.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

West.description: The forest extends westward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A little path, more of a game trail, really, runs through the bent and gnarled trunks of these evil-looking trees.  The main path goes north and west, and there is a small offshoot leading south to some kind of structure.

South.description: The little path runs to the south and widens.

West.description: The path disappears in the woods.

rooms.name: A Path Through the Twisted Forest
rooms.description: The ground seems a little more clear through here, so this must be whatever passes for a path.  The ground is quite packed solid, though you can see the occasional human (and nonhuman) print.  Some sort of pens lie to the south, while to the southeast, you can see some sort of building.

North.description: The path disappears into the forest.

East.description: The path extends eastward.

South.description: Some sort of ancient pens lie southward, past a broken gate.

rooms.name: Before an Ancient Building
rooms.description: The path peters out just in front of a rather large and decrepit building just to the south.  The ground here looks muddy, as if some scuffle occurred here recently.  To the north, brambles and thorns keep you from getting too inquisitive; there's no way anybody could get past those things!

South.description: A door to the south prevents entry.

West.description: The path snakes off to the west.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Witchy Abode
rooms.description: You stand in what is clearly some kind of entranceway, with exotic sounding pops and fizzles coming from the east.  The smell of sulphur seems quite strong here, in this black little foyer.  The building has long since been abandoned, and the floor tiles are sprouting some kind of evil-looking plant.

North.description: A door that has stood the test of time stands here.

East.description: A hallway opens up to a large Great Room.

rooms.name: Abandoned Animal Pens
rooms.description: The ground is trampled to the point of being hard as rock, but it's obvious no animals have been kept here anytime recently.  The fence all around this pen is completely delapidated and doesn't even fulfill its function; the gate to the north has no latch.  The pens extend to the south.  An abandoned house stands to the east, forming a natural wall to the pen.

North.description: The gate to the pens hangs askew.

South.description: The pens extend southward.

rooms.name: Abandoned Animal Pens
rooms.description: Though you can tell that this pen must have once held many animals, judging by the trampled ground and by the size of the enclosure formed by the fence going all around the area, it hasn't held anything recently.  A house to the east forms the eastern "wall" of the pen, but the fence in the other directions is completely falling apart.  A little stooped, open-walled structure seems to have been the manger and shelter both.

North.description: The pens extend northward.

extras.text: The wooden structure is so rickety it sways dangerously even in the most gentle of winds. It looks like it'd fall apart at a harsh word. But you can see that it's age, not bad building, that account for this shelter's condition. The center of the structure has a manger built into it.

rooms.name: A Workshop
rooms.description: Tables covered in what must have been cloth once sag and fall to the ground as you enter this cramped little chamber.  The darkness makes it difficult to see many details, but the smell of sulphur is quite strong, and you can see shelves full of little glass jars against the walls.

East.description: The only visible exit lies eastward, toward a hallway.

extras.text: The skeletons appear to be of tiny animals. Some appear to be those of dogs, or cats, or small rodents, but you can spot some impossibly small deer-like ones as well.

The wooden shelves are falling apart now, but at one time they must have lined the entire west and south walls. Glass jars of varying sizes and appearance crowd what few standing shelves there are, with shards all over the floor marking where jars were once. Most of the jars are empty, with a weird slimy film coating their insides, but in some, you can see various bones and skeletons.

rooms.name: An Abandoned Kitchen
rooms.description: Though this kitchen was long since abandoned, it was at one time fairly well kept, you can tell.  Now, though, plants burst from the floor and mildew grows on all the damp walls, and the roof overhead is clearly leaking and on its last legs.  A hallway to the north and west define the only visible exits.

North.description: You can see a Great Room of some kind to the north.

West.description: A dark room lies westward. What's in there?

rooms.name: An Abandoned Great Room
rooms.description: With the acrid stench of sulphur chasing you around, you stumble into this Great Room.  The chamber's wooden floor is broken into planks that splinter and crack at every step, while the walls and ceiling are spotted with holes that let in the light and weather.  An entranceway to the west and a hall to the south seem to be the only exits.

South.description: You can see a kitchen to the south.

West.description: You see the house's entranceway to the west.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A narrow little game trail winds between gnarled, twisted black trees that seem to reach out toward you with malevolent intent.  A sense of foreboding seems to fill this entire barren forest.

South.description: You can make your way south.

West.description: The narrow trail winds west.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A narrow little game trail winds between gnarled, twisted black trees that seem to reach out toward you with malevolent intent.  A sense of foreboding seems to fill this entire barren forest.

East.description: The trail winds off to the east.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A narrow little game trail winds between gnarled, twisted black trees that seem to reach out toward you with malevolent intent.  A sense of foreboding seems to fill this entire barren forest.

North.description: The forest extends northward.

West.description: The forest extends westward. You can see a sort of blue glow, but can't tell what's making it.

rooms.name: An Eerie Blue Glow
rooms.description: The moist black trunks of these twisted trees seem to glow with an unhealthy sky-blue glow that deepens as you look toward the south.  In fact, the curling blue mists seem to be rising from the ground, as well, and all of it seems to be forming an impenetrable wall to the south.

East.description: The forest extends eastward. You can't see the blue glow there.

West.description: The blue-glowing forest extends westward.

extras.text: The glowing wall seems as soft as clouds, but when you reach out to touch it, you discover it's as solid as stone. The wisps of fog seem to pulse with hidden anger as you approach, and it's with relief that you back off.

rooms.name: An Eerie Blue Glow
rooms.description: Thick blue fog forms a wall to the southeast, and the moisture coats the trunks and branches of the malformed black trees that crowd all around you. The trees, ground, and air all seem to be glowing with curling blue mists. The effect's not only entrancing, but threatening.

North.description: You can't see any more of the fog to the north.

East.description: The blue-glowing trees extend eastward.

rooms.name: An Eerie Blue Glow
rooms.description: The moist black trunks of these twisted trees seem to glow with an unhealthy sky-blue glow that deepens as you look toward the south.  In fact, the curling blue mists seem to be rising from the ground, as well, and all of it seems to be forming an impenetrable wall to the south.

North.description: The glowing forest extends northward.

West.description: The forest to the west appears less phosphorescent.

extras.text: The glowing wall seems as soft as clouds, but when you reach out to touch it, you discover it's as solid as stone. The wisps of fog seem to pulse with hidden anger as you approach, and it's with relief that you back off.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A narrow little game trail winds between gnarled, twisted black trees that seem to reach out toward you with malevolent intent.  A sense of foreboding seems to fill this entire barren forest.

East.description: The forest glows blue to the east. What is that?

South.description: The forest seems to glow blue to the south.

rooms.name: Blue-Glowing Twisted Trees
rooms.description: The black trees in this region all seem to glow with a soft, diffuse sky-blue light that comes from nowhere.  It's very subtle, but it fills you with dread.  It can't possibly be natural.

North.description: The forest seems malevolent, but less blue, to the north.

East.description: The blue effect seems more pronounced to the east.

South.description: The forest ends at a wall of thick blue fog.

rooms.name: An Eerie Blue Glow
rooms.description: The moist black trunks of these twisted trees seem to glow with an unhealthy sky-blue glow that deepens as you look toward the south.  In fact, the curling blue mists seem to be rising from the ground, as well, and all of it seems to be forming an impenetrable wall to the south and east.

West.description: The only visible exit lies to the west, through the forest.

rooms.name: An Eerie Blue Glow
rooms.description: The moist black trunks of these twisted trees seem to glow with an unhealthy sky-blue glow that deepens as you look toward the south.  In fact, the curling blue mists seem to be rising from the ground, as well, and all of it seems to be forming an impenetrable wall to the south and east.

North.description: The glowing forest extends to the north.

West.description: The glowing forest extends to the west.

rooms.name: An Eerie Blue Glow
rooms.description: The moist black trunks of these twisted trees seem to glow with an unhealthy sky-blue glow that deepens as you look toward the south.  In fact, the curling blue mists seem to be rising from the ground, as well, and all of it seems to be forming an impenetrable wall to the north, south, and west. A statue stands here.

East.description: The only visible way out of here is to the east, pushing through the weird blue fog.

extras.text: The statue is of a man whose features are very unlike those of an Ickle or Mielikki resident. The man wears ragged chain mail and other armors, and he raises his sword in defiance. In one hand he holds what seems to be a wand. Cloudy vapors seem to cling to the tip of the wand. A bronze plaque at the base of the statue has seen many better days.
The plaque reads: And so we call the mists.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A small clearing in the musty, gloomy forest barely merits the name, but since brambles and fallen branches impede in so many place, it's as good as any.  The trees themselves are wet and shiny in the greasy-feeling air.  No light reaches down through the thick, if bare, branches.  All in all, it's not a picnic spot.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

South.description: The forest extends southward. Amazingly, you think you can see blue light up ahead.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: This dark, creepy forest seems unlike any other batch of trees.  Each misshapen, gnarled, leafless tree almost reaches out to get you!  The barren ground appears almost swept clean, as well.  There's no sound and little sign of animal life.

North.description: The forest extends northward.

West.description: The forest extends westward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: This dark, creepy forest seems unlike any other batch of trees.  Each misshapen, gnarled, leafless tree almost reaches out to get you!  The barren ground appears almost swept clean, as well.  There's no sound and little sign of animal life.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

West.description: The forest extends westward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: This dark, creepy forest seems unlike any other batch of trees.  Each misshapen, gnarled, leafless tree almost reaches out to get you!  The barren ground appears almost swept clean, as well.  There's no sound and little sign of animal life.

North.description: The forest extends northward. Far away, you see much larger trees.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

West.description: The forest extends westward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: A sturdy wall of large black thornbushes marks the western boundary of this evil-smelling forest.  The gnarled black trees seem to shrink away from those brambles.  A closer look at that wall shows a kind of curling blue mist rising up from them, but you sure wouldn't want to go near it, for any of those little knife-like thorns could shred a human to bits.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: This dark, creepy forest seems unlike any other batch of trees.  Each misshapen, gnarled, leafless tree almost reaches out to get you!  The barren ground appears almost swept clean, as well.  There's no sound and little sign of animal life.

North.description: The forest extends northward.

West.description: The forest extends westward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Gnarled little misshapen trees crowd close together, their leafless branches blocking out the light overhead.  The barren ground at your feet seems to be lifeless, and there don't seem to be many signs of animals around here.  To the north and west, a fierce-looking bramble patch prevents passage.  A weird blue mist seems to curl around those thorns, but something about them seems to caution against investigating them too closely.

East.description: The forest extends eastward.

South.description: The forest extends southward.

rooms.name: The Twisted Forest
rooms.description: Gnarled little misshapen trees crowd close together, their leafless branches blocking out the light overhead.  The barren ground at your feet seems to be lifeless, and there don't seem to be many signs of animals around here.  To the west, a fierce-looking bramble patch prevents passage.  A weird blue mist seems to curl around those thorns.

North.description: The forest extends northward, ending at a bramble patch.
